J

job_comm_reply - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
Reply of the enemy to your hail, default to "The other $shipOrFleet does not answer to you hails."
job_conclusion_script - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
optional, can be used to give additional rewards or add further consequences in case of failure using memkeys to check the outcome
job_credit_reward - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
 
job_credit_scaling - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
only used with fleet scaling: total reward = job_credits_reward * (job_reward_scaling * (bounty fleet DP / fleet_minimal_DP) )
job_deadline - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
 
job_description - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
full text of the bounty offer, the description will handle some text variables such as "$he_or_she".
job_difficultyDescription - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
"none": no description, "auto": bounty board describes how dangerous the bounty is, any other text: bounty board displays the text
job_forFaction - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
successfully completing this mission with give a small reputation reward with this faction
job_intel_expired - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
short text added to the Intel object after the job has been left to expire
job_intel_failure - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
short text added to the Intel object after the job has been failed
job_intel_success - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
short text added to the Intel object after the job has been successfully completed
job_item_reward - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
 
job_memKey - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
optional, MemKey set to false is added when accepting the job, set to true if the job is sucessful
job_name - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
job name in the dialog pick list
job_pick_option - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
dialog text to pick the job
job_pick_script - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
optional, can be used to trigger further scripts when the mission is taken, for example you may want to have competing bounty hunters
job_reputation_reward - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
 
job_show_arrow - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
 
job_show_captain - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
 
job_show_distance - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
how precisely the distance to the target is shown on the bounty board.
job_show_fleet - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
how much of the fleet to show on the bounty board.
job_show_type - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
assassination: requires only to disable the flagship destruction: requires the complete destruction of the flagship without recovery obliteration: requires the complete destruction or disabling of the enemy fleet neutralisation: requires the destruction or disabling of 2/3rd of the enemy fleet default to assassination
job_type - Variable in class data.scripts.bounty.BountyData
assassination, destruction, obliteration, neutralisation
JSONfailed - Static variable in class data.scripts.bounty.MagicBountyLoader
